author: Batty
title: Amazing bed side manner
body: Had a hysteroscopy procedure done yesterday at Maternity wing at Lincoln County Hospital. They rang me in the morning to go for the afternoon as they had a cancellation, I was only 5 /10 mins waiting for my appointment. A lovely lady called Jackie walked me in & helped Nicky the sister who was doing the procedure. All the way through they were making me at ease & had amazing bed side manner. Jess who was a health care was talking to me all the time to keep me occupied. I was so scared before I went in, but all the ladies were amazing & im so thankful at that.

author: Poppy333
title: Excellent care during 2 trips to A&E
body:
I have been taken to hospital, twice, in the past few weeks, by Scottish Ambulance. Both crews were amazing..think it was Alison & Gary and then Jane and sorry, forgot the other guy's name. But both crews were professional, caring and funny...humour, is definitely something you need!  
The A & E staff, at the RAH, were also great!! Really caring and lovely..especially, the 2nd time...Nurse Lydia, always came in to check on me.  
I had severe stomach pain and shortness of breath. It might be stomach ulcers. I've had pain for 5 weeks, on max dose of gastro tabs & H2 inhibitors.  
So, today, my gp has referred me for an urgent scan and endoscopy. Could you please let me know, when, these tests are going to be available?  
Thank you

author: Emmrd63
title: Community Mental Health Advocacy
body:
Dear Roisin  
I am writing this e mail to command the above person for the support and action she took on my behalf as a mental health advocate . We were rushed for time but her efficient and professional intervention had the desired effect and my meeting with my psychiatrist went well due to her input  
Thank you

title: very great practice
body: Actually I did not make a physical visit to the location, as I was a new registration, and had to use the the online registration facility, with email correspondence. and the service I have received was perfect, and would like to thank all members of NHS, Gladstone Medical team, and in particular the lady who does the registrations, for her quick and sufficient response.

title: Awful experiences
body: Nems platform one is one of the worst practices I have ever been to, I asked for several medication reviews, still didn’t have any. Asked for several referrals for my recurrent Pain and have been ignored and just given antibiotics. Since two years I’ve been running after this surgery to help me with my pain and I haven’t had my results from tests, neither have I got any referrals to help. They never did A blood test on me, even though I asked for it several times. My mental health has been deteriorating and I asked for help and all I get is that I sound perky and I should stay on the medication I am on already which doesn’t work enough for me. Seems like they don’t take it serious, I’m holding them responsible for several of my issues and that I have not been given the help I need. I can’t describe my disappointment and I am so angry this practice is even open, should be closed as it’s making me feel depressed having to be in constant pain due to incapability of this surgery i feel absolute helpless. GPs should be there to help and take your issues serious. I’m still in pain like two years ago, NEMS platform one has done nothing for me. Also long waiting times, once waited for 1 hour. Ok staff, nice nurses tho but haven’t got much time to actually do anything. 5 mins in and out really. The quicker the better. Antibiotics being prescribed  like tic tacs. Utterly disappointed.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Couldn't be better
body: Treated by A and E then opthalmics today. Everyone from reception on was  approachable ,well informed, respectful and put me at ease. My problem was diagnosed and pre op tests done ready for early proceedure a.s.a.p. Every thing was explained clearly. THANK YOU SO MUCH

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust
